intro: Ornithogalum luschanii, commonly known as the Luschan's star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is part of the Asparagaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Due to its striking appearance, it is cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value.
